tool.name: AutoCycler GFA to FASTA
tool.description: convert GFA assembly graph to FASTA sequences
tool.command:
#import re
#if $in_gfa.is_of_type("gfa1") #set $safename = re.sub('[^\w\-_\.]', '_', $in_gfa.element_identifier) ln -s $in_gfa '${safename}' && autocycler gfa2fasta --in_gfa '${safename}' --out_fasta output.fa #else echo "${in_gfa} is not a gfa file" #end if

param.name: in_gfa
param.label: Input GFA file
param.help: Assembly graph in GFA format to convert

tool.help:
**AutoCycler GFA to FASTA Tool**
This tool converts assembly graphs in GFA format to FASTA sequences.
**Inputs** - Input GFA file (assembly graph)
**Outputs** - FASTA file containing sequences from the graph
**Parameters** - Output filename: Name for the resulting FASTA file
**Notes** - Extracts all sequences from the GFA file - Preserves sequence identifiers from the original graph - Useful for downstream analysis requiring FASTA format - Maintains sequence quality and integrity
